intro: Verbascum schimperianum, commonly known as the Schimper's mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often covered in fine, soft hairs. Verbascum schimperianum is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal areas.
